title: A Doran's Shield Buff to fix Top lane Meta
body:
The top lane meta is very stale at the moment. Only ranged champions are truly viable (Gnar, Jayce, Gangplank, Kennen).

Many people have probably forgotten, but Doran's shield used to give 100 health instead of 80 and it used to give 10/5 regen instead of 6/5. I believe that if Doran's shield was buffed, we would see greater diversity in the top lane. Picks like Shen, Garen, Maokai, Singed, Mundo, Sion, Malphite could see much more play. 

The biggest reason I don't build Doran's shield is because you can only buy 1 potion at the start. It simply isn't enough versus these oppressive ranged champions when you are playing a tank. Starting Doran's shield usually means you will run through your potion and be forced out of lane before the first cannon wave. As it stands, I would never build Doran's shield as my first item against a ranged champion, I would just buy corrupting potion every time.

Ideas for buff:

* Instead of only blocking 8 damage from single target spells, allow it to block 8 damage from AOE spells too (ie Gnar boomerang, Jayce Q)

* Lower the cost to 400 from 450 (this would allow you to purchase 2 health potions at lvl 1)

* Revert Doran's shield to 100 health and 10 per 5 health regen.

* Buff the damage blocked from basic attacks if the basic attacks are ranged

* Add a tiny thorn-mail like passive (3 damage returned to attacker per auto)

Note: I am not suggesting all of these buffs, just maybe one of them. Doran's shield only needs a tiny buff to be viable and allow more tanks to be played without getting totally destroyed early in this meta.

While true, there is a hierarchy of the Dorans/starting items. 

* {{item:1054}}  is the worst. Similar stats as other Dorans, its passive is useful depending on the matchup, the regen it provides (HP) is low, and coupled with a high health pool of champs that would like to start a defensive items, isnt too useful. 
* {{item:1055}} is decent. Provides some nice stats up front, but Id say its about the same as shield in terms of effectiveness at level 1. However, the 3% lifesteal is intended to scale - the more AD you get throughout the game, the better the item gets. Its really the only one worth keeping - a 4 item Mage would probably sell the D.Ring for an Amp Tome midgame. A 4 item ADC would rather keep the D.Blade than sell for a Longsword. 
* {{item:1056}} is good. A nice chunk of AP to start out the game - more efficient than any other item in its price class at Level 1, and decent MP regen that stays useful until you finish a major mana item.
* {{item:1083}} has the best regen until the first back, but at the expense of no extra health and quickly falling behind D.Blade after the first back. Passive is pretty useful, but only if you survive that long without getting behind. 
* {{item:1082}} is the weird one. Great if you get ahead, but the 25% extra potion can also be good in lanes with a lot of trading. Seems like its for either super aggressive lanes to stack as early as possible, or super passive lanes where you need the extra potions. 

While Dorans items are generally early game items, they all have different effectiveness at different stages of the game. Blade is really the only one worth keeping past 4 items.
